sources.snippet_or_excerpt: Senate talks on crypto market structure show renewed momentum, with lawmakers and industry preparing for a delayed but advancing markup.
The crypto sector went increasingly mainstream in 2025, with regulatory moves in Australia, US states exploring Bitcoin reserves and new...
Bitcoin has entered a critical make-or-break phase as price clings to key weekly support while momentum continues to fade.
Executives and lobbyists attended a meeting today with Senator Tim Scott and others to hash out the ongoing talks over crypto's most...
Despite its relative volatility, cryptocurrency has gained significant attention as a legitimate financial asset in the global market.

hypothesis_content.title: BTC Momentum Reversal from Weekly Support
hypothesis_content.statement: If Bitcoin (BTC) holds above its critical weekly support level (approx. $85,000) and then records a bullish engulfing 4-hour candle, it will trigger a short-term momentum reversal leading to a 3-5% rally within 48 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Recent news highlights Bitcoin in a 'make-or-break' phase with weekly support holding. A bullish engulfing pattern at a defended major support level is a classic momentum reversal signal, often catching shorts off guard and attracting sidelined capital. The neutral regime provides a lower volatility base for this move to develop.
entry_conditions: BTC 4-hour candle closes above $86,500 (confirms support hold)
The subsequent 4-hour candle is a bullish engulfing pattern (high > prior high, low < prior low, close > prior open)
The 4-hour RSI(14) crosses above 40 from below

exit_conditions.stop_loss: 1.5% loss from entry price OR a close below $85,800 on a 4-hour basis
exit_conditions.time_exit: 48 hours after entry if neither TP nor SL is hit

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: A failure to generate a 3% move within 48 hours after a valid entry signal, or more than 60% of such signals resulting in the stop-loss being hit before the take-profit over a sample of 20 events.
